item.title: 津巴布韦财政部长会见美国官员寻求降低关税
item.description: 据津巴布韦财政部长姆图利-恩库比（Mthuli Ncube）称，津巴布韦与美国官员会面，争取降低美国总统唐纳德-特朗普本月早些时候对津巴布韦征收的关税。【原文：Zimbabwe met with US officials to argue for lower tariffs than those imposed on the nation by President Donald Trump earlier this month, according to Mthuli Ncube, the finance minister.】

item.title: 欧洲央行武契奇称目前的关税并非欧洲的最坏情况
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员鲍里斯-武伊契奇（Boris Vujcic）表示，美国目前的关税配置并不是对欧元区经济增长最不利的因素&mdash；与他的一些同事相比，武伊契奇对前景的看法更为乐观。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Boris Vujcic said the current configuration of US tariffs isn’t the most detrimental for euro-zone growth — striking a more upbeat tone on the outlook than some of his colleagues.】

item.title: TA Associates 即将达成收购二级市场公司 Kline Hill 股份的交易
item.description: 据一位知情人士透露，TA Associates 接近达成收购 Kline Hill Partners 大量股份的交易。【原文：TA Associates is close to a deal to acquire a significant stake in Kline Hill Partners, a firm focused on secondaries bets, according to a people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 阿特金斯说，美国证券交易委员会已拥有监管加密货币的充分权力
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会主席保罗-阿特金斯（Paul Atkins）周五表示，即使国会不采取行动，该委员会在监管数字资产方面也有 "足够的操作空间"。【原文：The US Securities and Exchange Commission has “ample room to maneuver” in regulating digital assets even without congressional action, Chairman Paul Atkins said Friday.】

item.title: DoorDash 提议以 36 亿美元收购 Deliveroo
item.description: Deliveroo Plc.表示，它收到了竞争对手外卖公司DoorDash Inc.的提议，以每股1.80英镑（2.40美元）的价格收购这家总部位于英国的初创公司。【原文：Deliveroo Plc. said it received a proposal from rival delivery company DoorDash Inc. to buy the UK-based startup for £1.80 ($2.40) a share.】

item.title: 淡水河谷预计铁矿石价格将高于每吨 85 美元，尽管关税动荡不安
item.description: 淡水河谷公司（Vale SA）是世界顶级铁矿石生产商之一，该公司驳斥了分析师关于在关税引发经济放缓的情况下炼钢材料价格将跌破每吨 85 美元的预测。【原文：Vale SA, one of the world’s top iron ore producers, dismissed analysts’ predictions that prices of the steelmaking material will tumble below $85 a ton amid a tariff-fueled economic slowdown.】

item.title: Cantor SPAC 交易成为比特币工具，股价暴涨 220
item.description: 交易员们进一步追捧一家空头公司的股票，这家公司将成为最新上市的比特币投资工具，其预期市值将达到其所持加密货币预估价值的三倍左右。【原文：Traders piled further into shares of a blank-check company that’s set to become the latest publicly traded Bitcoin investment vehicle, bidding its expected market capitalization to around three times the estimated value of the cryptocurrency it would hold.】

item.title: 巴克莱称，学校对抗特朗普，哈佛公共债券值得买入
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）的一位策略师表示，对特朗普政府与哈佛大学争斗的担忧导致该校的市政债券价格下跌，从而创造了一个买入机会。【原文：Concerns about the Trump administration’s fight with Harvard University have caused the school’s municipal bonds to cheapen, creating a buying opportunity, according to a Barclays Plc strategist.】

item.title: 贸易紧张局势有缓解迹象，国债随美元反弹
item.description: 由于有迹象表明特朗普政府正在努力缓和贸易紧张局势，国债连续第二周反弹，几乎抹平了本月的跌幅。【原文：Treasuries rallied for a second week, all but erasing this month’s losses, amid signs the Trump administration is making efforts to deescalate trade tensions.】

item.title: 里夫斯称与贝森特讨论的交易将同时服务于英国和美国
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）周五表示，她与美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）就一项符合两国 "国家利益 "的 "经济繁荣协议 "举行了会谈。【原文：UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said Friday she held talks with US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent about an “economic prosperity deal” that will serve both countries’ “national interests.”】

item.title: 苏里南在投票前与国际货币基金组织会面讨论后续计划
item.description: 据苏里南财政部长称，苏里南政府官员正在与国际货币基金组织（IMF）会面，讨论在之前的 6.88 亿美元协议于今年 3 月到期后的第二个计划框架。【原文：Suriname government official are meeting with the International Monetary Fund to discuss frameworks for a second program after a prior $688 million agreement expired in March, according to its finance minister.】

item.title: 20 世纪 80 年代美联储董事会通胀鹰派人物韦恩-安格尔逝世，享年 94 岁
item.description: 韦恩-安格尔（Wayne Angell）去世，他从 1986 年起在联邦储备委员会任职八年，将一个农民对通货膨胀的警惕带到了美国的货币政策制定中。享年 94 岁。【原文：Wayne Angell, who brought a farmer’s wariness of inflation to US monetary policy-making during an eight-year term on the Federal Reserve Board of Governors starting in 1986, has died. He was 94.】

item.title: 新游戏《Sunderfolk》就像 D&D 与《Jackbox》的结合
item.description:
本片导演艾琳-马雷克（Erin Marek）现年 30 岁，在转行从事电子游戏开发之前是一名生物学家

。【原文：

Erin Marek, the title’s 30-year-old director, was a biologist before switching to video-game development

】

item.title: 微软在安全修复后发布 Windows 召回工具
item.description: 微软公司正在向高端 Windows PC 推出备受争议的 "召回"（Recall）功能，并打赌记录用户在电脑上的操作将被视为一种好处而非隐私风险。【原文：Microsoft Corp. is rolling out its controversial Recall feature to high-end Windows PCs, betting a record of what users do on their computers will be seen as more of a benefit than a privacy risk.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔走钢丝：迟到但不 "迟到先生
item.description: 杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）决心确保唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税政策所导致的任何价格上涨不会在经济中蔓延，这为他赢得了总统 "太迟先生"（Mr. Too Late）的称号。对于这位美联储主席来说，这比成为 "错误先生 "要好得多。【原文：Jerome Powell’s determination to ensure any jump in prices stemming from Donald Trump’s tariffs don’t spread through the economy has earned him the moniker “Mr. Too Late” from the president. For the Federal Reserve chair, that’s better than being Mr. Wrong.】

item.title: 里夫斯希望在 5 月初公布新的英国养老基金协议
item.description: 英国政府准备最快于 5 月 6 日宣布与养老基金管理公司达成一项新协议，该协议可能会向英国私人市场注入数百亿英镑的资金。【原文：The UK government is preparing to announce a fresh deal with pension fund managers as soon as May 6, which could pour tens of billions of pounds into the country’s private markets.】

item.title: 尼克斯队广播公司在债务重组中从贷款人处获得生命线
item.description: MSG Networks Inc. 已与贷款方达成债务重组协议，避免了这家由詹姆斯-多兰（James Dolan）领导的体育广播公司申请破产的可能，同时也让债权人避免了潜在的巨额损失。【原文：MSG Networks Inc. has reached an agreement with lenders to restructure its debt load, averting a potential bankruptcy filing for the James Dolan-led sports broadcaster while handing creditors potential sharp losses.】

item.title: 加拿大大选获胜者面临的经济濒临衰退
item.description: 经济学家预测，加拿大的下一任总理将继承为期半年的经济平缓增长，这是对其执政能力的直接考验，因为唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易战导致商业投资和出口下降。【原文：Canada’s next prime minister is set to inherit a half-year of flat economic growth, economists predict, an immediate test of their governance as President Donald Trump’s trade war grinds business investment and exports lower.】

item.title: 萨克斯因关税和供应商欠款问题而考虑再次举债
item.description: 萨克斯全球企业（Saks Global Enterprises）表示，由于唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的贸易政策可能对美国零售业造成冲击，该公司正在考虑举借更多债务，以寻求支撑其财务状况。【原文：Saks Global Enterprises said it’s considering raising more debt, seeking to shore up its finances as President Donald Trump’s trade policies threaten to batter the US retail sector.】

item.title: 英国央行格林指出美元在过去危机中反弹
item.description: 英国央行利率制定者梅根-格林（Megan Greene）说，历史表明，在经济动荡时期，美元往往会反弹，她强调了汇率变动对英国货币政策的重要性。【原文：Bank of England rate-setter Megan Greene said history shows the US dollar has often rebounded during periods of economic strife as she highlighted the importance of exchange-rate movements for UK monetary policy.】

item.title: 联邦调查局称老年人在网络犯罪浪潮中首当其冲
item.description: 在家使用智能手机和笔记本电脑的老人【原文：Senior man at home with smartphone and laptop】

item.title: 美元有望迎来尼克松就任总统以来最糟糕的头 100 天
item.description: 在尼克松时代，美国放弃了金本位制，转而采用自由浮动汇率，根据当时的数据，美元指数有望创下美国总统任期头 100 天的最差表现。【原文：A dollar gauge is on track for its worst performance during the first 100 days of a US presidency in data going back to the Nixon era, when America abandoned the gold standard and switched to a free-floating exchange rate.】

item.title: 华尔街在强劲的财政流动中将债务上限日期推迟
item.description: 由于 4 月份税收和关税的强劲增长，华尔街正在推迟对美国政府何时用尽债务上限下的借贷授权的预期，目前的预测集中在 8 月至 10 月期间。【原文：Wall Street is pushing back their expectations as to when the US government will exhaust its borrowing authority under the debt ceiling because of April’s robust tax and tariff collections, with forecasts now focused on the August to October period.】

item.title: 维托尔在美国许可证到期前加紧购买委内瑞拉原油
item.description: 维托尔集团（Vitol Group）在获得美国许可的最后几周里加大了在委内瑞拉的石油采购力度，美国许可允许这家全球最大的独立石油贸易商在委内瑞拉开展业务。【原文：Vitol Group has stepped up oil purchases in Venezuela in the final weeks of a US license that allows the world’s largest independent oil trader to do business in the sanctioned nation.】

item.title: 土耳其中央银行在美国投资者会议上兜售强势里拉
item.description: 据参加了土耳其央行官员最近与全球投资者会晤的人士称，土耳其央行承诺将维持足够紧缩的货币政策，以允许里拉实际升值。【原文：Turkey’s central bank pledged to maintain a sufficiently tight monetary policy that will allow the lira to appreciate in real terms, according to people who participated in officials’ recent meetings with global investors.】

item.title: 政策制定者考虑关税问题，欧元区通胀放缓
item.description: 欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank）恢复 2% 通胀率的任务已接近尾声，4 月份的通胀数据将仅比目标值低一小部分。【原文：The European Central Bank’s task of restoring 2% inflation is almost complete, with April’s reading set to come in only a fraction north of that target.】

item.title: Codelco 在铜矿复苏的漫长道路上又迈出了一步
item.description: 尽管受到电力、天气和维护中断的影响，Codelco 公司第一季度的产量仍略有增长，因为这家全球最大的铜生产商正在努力弥补矿石质量下降的影响。【原文：Codelco posted a slight increase in first-quarter output despite power, weather and maintenance interruptions, as the world’s biggest copper producer battles to compensate for deteriorating ore quality.】

item.title: 中国人民银行潘功胜承诺在必要时采取更多措施应对关税冲击
item.description: 中国央行行长潘功胜表示，如有必要，中国将采取新的政策支持经济，以抵御外部冲击，这与高层官员发出的采取耐心态度支持经济增长的最新信号是一致的。【原文：China will adopt new policy support for the economy to counter external shocks if needed, central bank governor Pan Gongsheng said, in line with top officials’ latest signals of taking a patient approach to supporting growth.】

item.title: 银行为 Sycamore 的 Boots 收购案准备 42.5 亿美元的债务销售
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc. 是准备出售 42.5 亿美元债务支持 Sycamore Partners 收购英国药店 Boots 的华尔街十几家银行之一，该收购是私募股权公司收购沃尔格林博姿联盟公司（Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. is among about a dozen Wall Street banks preparing to sell $4.25 billion of debt backing Sycamore Partners’ buyout of UK pharmacy Boots, part of the private equity firm’s acquisition of Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc.】

item.title: 能源部门复苏，安巴尼的信实公司利润超出预期
item.description: 亿万富翁穆克什-安巴尼（Mukesh Ambani）控制的信实工业有限公司（Reliance Industries Ltd.）公布的季度利润好于预期，原因是其石油化工业务的复苏与面向消费者的部门的强劲表现相得益彰。【原文：Reliance Industries Ltd., controlled by billionaire Mukesh Ambani, reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit, as a recovery in its oil-to-chemical business added to a strong show by consumer-facing units.】
